title: Police Officer
description: Kind of Work Responsible, professional analytical, technical and administrative work in the recruitment of employees for the New Orleans Police Department. Work includes: Planning, scheduling, and coordinating NOPD recruitment events. Assisting in the development of recruitment materials. Developing and updating NOPD's recruiting strategy. Identifying and prioritizing high value candidates. Referring interested applicants to the appropriate NOPD officers in order to address specific inquiries regarding the duties and lifestyle of a police officer. Communicating and collaborating with internal and external agencies and stakeholder groups on recruitment matters. Providing information about NOPD careers as requested to interested applicants and organizations. Disseminating updates and recruitment materials to targeted lists of interested individuals. Performing related duties as required. Evening and weekend work is required. This position requires the ability to move objects including boxes of promotional materials (up to 25 pounds). **In addition to competitive City benefits, employees in this position are also eligible for special incentive payments of $500 for every 25 applicants they recruit who take the Police Recruit Exam, $500 for each applicant they recruit who is hired as a Police Recruit/Officer, and $500 for each applicant they recruit who graduates from the Police Academy. There is no limit to the number of these special incentive payments a Police Recruiter can earn. Minimum Qualifications 1. A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university * AND 2. One (1) year of professional experience in human resources, recruiting, marketing, public relations, communications, business management or a related field. This position requires a one (1) year probationary period. NOTE: Professional experience is paid experience gained in a position that required a Bachelor's degree upon entrance. Civil Service reserves the right to determine what is considered to be professional experience. Civil Service reserves the right to determine which experience qualifies as relevant. Prior to appointment, the hiring agency is required to verify education claimed by the applicant to qualify for this classification. If selected for hire, applicants must provide original documents of their qualifying credentials to the hiring agency prior to their start date in this job classification. Kind of Examination A written examination, weighted 100%. The Management Development Analyst examination is a written test designed to measure: Basic Management Principles, Decision-Making and Organizing, Interpersonal Skills, Written Communication, and Mathematics. This is an original entrance examination. title: Cm Analyst- Mca/ir
description: POSITION PURPOSE The CBM Team Lead is responsible for providing leadership and communication directly between the Allied Solutions Delivery Manager and the assigned Allied Reliability CBM resources, when not directly responsible for his or her resource assignment with a client. The CBM Team Lead is responsible for ensuring all CBM work is completed per the proposal and meets internal standards for quality and delivery, is the initial client point of contact, and prepares the necessary reports and required audits. The CBM Team Lead will be accountable for the overall safety of the work environment for the crew, including ensuring compliance with Allied, client, OSHA, and all other applicable standards. The CBM Team Lead performs and oversees specific projects and programs as assigned. The CBM Team Lead is also expected to be a technical resource to the client and employees, as well as a coach for assigned resources in the troubleshooting of mechanical and electrical equipment, or identifying internal resources that can assist. This includes supporting some clients in the capacity of a Lead Analyst. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES Assumes responsibility for communication and education between Allied Reliability, clients, and direct reports. Responsible for communicating the Allied Reliability deliverables to the client and to the employees under direct supervision. Conducts Technology Awareness Sessions. Submits documented case studies for customer/employee newsletters. Provides input into the development of the Individual Training Plans for each employee under direct supervision. Assumes coordination and scheduling activities in the following areas: Responsible for schedule compliance, route adherence, and analysis reporting within client SLA. Single pint of contact for client on service delivery questions or issues Assumes responsibility for necessary auditing, metrics, and reporting, including but not limited to: Ensuring all databases are in compliance with current standards Nuisance Alarm Management Management f Change Process Adherence The accuracy and timeliness f all internal and external communications and reporting Follows all Safety, Allied Reliability, Customer, and other established policies, processes, procedures, standards, and practices while achieving defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and meeting customer and plant goals and objectives. Performs Behavioral Safety Observations as needed. Leads and mentors safety training discussions with assigned Allied Reliability team members. Assumes responsibility for ensuring that the Allied Reliability Best Practice Methods are communicated and executed. Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned. Performs special projects as assigned. Training/mentoring will include, but is not limited to: Working directly with Workforce Excellence team on recommended training and ensuring employees needs are met. Helping with mentoring/coaching of newer and less experienced employees. Supports client and employees with use of SmartCBM. Oversees and supports the execution of Connected, Regional, and FTE predictive technology services implemented at customer sites, to include Vibration, Infrared Thermography, Motor Circuit Analysis (MCA), Ultrasonics, Oil Management Analysis, and others as applicable. Oversees and supprts the setup of CBM programs as required including development, implementation, and maintenance of CBM technology databases. Ensures information is accurate, up to date, and in compliance with Best Practice standards. Oversees and manages all database changes, nuisance alarms, and change process adherence. Supports and communicates with DSM regarding improvements of the customers Equipment Maintenance Plan. Communicates Condition Monitoring Best Practice methods to Allied Reliability teams. Trains and mentors as needed in support of the CBM program. Provides technical assistance in equipment troubleshooting and diagnosis. Works with DSM to audit, track, and report on KPIs and metrics and address gaps in program implementation, effectiveness, and efficiency. Works directly with Allied Reliability teams and DSM to correct defects and eliminate failures with customer. Ensures accuracy and timeliness of all communications and reporting. Supports specific measures of success to include, but not limited to: Billable Utilization > 80% 100% Monthly Client Delivery (as agreed to in Proposal) SmartCBM Database Accuracy > 95% Including attribute information, equipment component classes, analysis parameter / collection specifications, and alarm limits Builds partnerships and works collaboratively within the Allied Reliability team and with DSM to meet shared objectives. Networks with others to share knowledge, information, and Best Practices. Oversees scheduling of regional CBM resource assignments to also include non-billable time such as training, PTO, and short- and long-term disability, and accordingly with FTE resources. As an Analyst, manages or deploys technology based on EMP, field inspections, data collection, and analysis when applicable, in accordance with Best Practice standards. Supports DSM in service accuracy for billing as needed. Supports DSM when needed in the support of commercial development of potential, new, or revised proposals and contracts. WORK BALANCE 50% CBM Remote Analysis and Reporting 50% CBM Regional Leadership Responsibilities PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS (Baselines TBD) Accuracy and the timeliness of all internal and external communications of team members, and end of the month closeout reports, including analysis reports delivered within agreed upon window. Technical reporting of team members meets or exceeds Allieds established standards. Databases are correct to current standards and audit schedules are being adhered to. Managing utilization across team and pushing continuous improvement during non-billable hours. Accuracy of monthly Resource Management schedule compliance. QUALIFICATIONS /COMPETENCIES /POSITION REQUIREMENTS Education/Certification & Experience Required: At least 5 years field experience and associated knowledge of reliability principles. High school graduate or equivalent. College Degree preferred. ASNT-TC1A or ASNT-CP189 Certifications or equivalent where applicable. CBM Team Lead should possess or have the ability to obtain an ASNT Level 2 Certification in a core technology with Level 1 Certification in 2 other technologies. CBM Team Lead should have experience with and knowledge of Reliability principles and be able to demonstrate through taking certifications tests such as CMRP, Six Sigma, etc. Required Knowledge: Working knowledge of condition monitoring technologies and their integration, including oil analysis, motor current analysis, and ultrasonics. Knowledge of machinery fundamentals, including pumps, motors, gearboxes, blowers, compressors, etc. Detailed knowledge of general mechanical fundamentals, such as fits and tolerances. Working knowledge of routine and advanced data acquisition techniques used in Allied Reliabilitys SmartCBM continual monitoring platform. Knowledge in spectral, time waveform and phase analysis. Working knowledge of other condition monitoring technologies, including oil analysis, thermography, motor current analysis and ultrasonics, and their integration. Proficient in the execution, maintaining, quality of data, and training of SmartCBM, or similar tool. Skills/Abilities: Leadership and project management skills. Good oral and written communication skills; able to prepare memos, reports, and essays using proper punctuation, spelling, and grammar. Proficient computer skills, including but not limited to Windows, Word, and Excel. Solid analytical and problem-solving abilities. Able to work well independently. PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION Repetitive Motions: Movements frequently and regularly required using the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. TRAVEL: Minimum 50% travel required. Talking: Especially where one must frequently convey detailed or important instructions or ideas accurately, loudly, or quickly. GOOD Visual Abilities: Keen visual acuity necessary to prepare or inspect documents or products, or operate, inspect, and adjust machinery. Average Hearing: Able to hear average or normal conversations and receive ordinary information. Physical Strength: Alternating periods of active work and sedentary work. Exerts up to 40 lbs. of force occasionally.

title: IT Analyst
description: All Job Postings will close at 12:01a.m. CST (1:01a.m. EST) on the specified Closing Date (if designated). If you close the browser or exit your application prior to submitting, the application progress will be saved as a draft. You will be able to access and complete the application through “My Draft Applications” located on your Candidate Home page. Job Posting Title: IT Analyst I Position Type: Professional / Unclassified Department: LSUAM ORED - SPI - NISC - LEO - Web Development (Wayne L Arena Jr. (00001584)) Work Location: LSU - Baton Rouge Pay Grade: Professional Job Description: Assists in the development and implementation of content on websites. May be involved with integrating work of writers and designers to produce a final layout compatible with corporate standards. Requires a bachelor's degree with 0-2 years of experience. May be expected to have knowledge of HTML, DHTML and JavaScript programming language. Relies on experience, and judgement to perform the functions of the job. Works under general supervision. Typically reports to a supervisor or manager. Job Responsibilities: Responsible for the conversion of documents to various online formats, including Portable Document Format (PDF) and HTML. (75%) Maintain graphic, usability, and accessibility integrity for web site, and assist with quality assurance testing during non-peak hours.(10%) Create professional graphics for print media and web projects (10%) Conceptualize original website design ideas and create wireframes and storyboards for those ideas. Other duties as assigned by the supervisor. (5%) Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree and 0-2 years experience; plus some understanding of web design capabilities and HTML; Proficiency in standard desktop applications; Basic understanding of various operating systems, platforms, file structures, file formats, and protocols; Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies. Preferred Experience: Previous experience creating websites — please submit sample URLs when applying; Content Management Systems (CMS); Experience with web development tools such as Dreamweaver and Photoshop; XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP, Illustrator, Publisher, Excel; familiarity with Section 508 accessibility requirements and compliance methods; experience working in Portal environment; experience designing, developing, documenting, testing, and debugging Java-based web applications; basic familiarity with database architecture and entity-relationship structure. Special Qualifications: Must be able to pass National security background check. May be required to be on evenings and weekends or work during emergency situations such as hurricanes or other natural disasters. May be required on-call duty. Some travel may be required. Additional Job Description: Special Instructions: In accordance with University Policy Statement 18, this position is considered essential and may be required to report or stay on campus in the event of emergency or closure. Posting Date: January 30, 2023 Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified): Additional Position Information: Background Check - An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. Benefits - LSU offers outstanding benefits to eligible employees and their dependents including health, life, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; retirement options; various leave options; paid holidays; wellness benefits; tuition exemption for qualified positions; training and development opportunities; employee discounts; and more! Remote Work - Positions approved to work remotely outside the State of Louisiana shall be employed through Louisiana State University’s partner, nextSource Workforce Solutions, for Employer of Record Services including but not limited to employment, benefits, payroll, and tax compliance. Positions employed through Employer of Record Services will be offered benefits and retirement as applicable through their provider and will not be eligible for State of Louisiana benefits and retirement. Essential Position (Y/N): Y LSU is an Equal Opportunity Employer: LSU believes diversity, equity, and inclusion enrich the educational experience of our students, faculty, and staff, and are necessary to prepare all people to thrive personally and professionally in a global society. We celebrate diversity and are committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion. We actively seek and encourage qualified applications from persons with diverse backgrounds, cultures and experiences. To learn more about how LSU is committed to diversity and inclusivity, please see LSU’s Diversity Statement and Roadmap . Persons needing accommodations or assistance with the accessibility of materials related to this search are encouraged to contact the Office of Human Resource Management ( hr@lsu.edu ). HCM Contact Information: Questions or concerns can be directed to the LSU Human Resources Management Office at 225-578-8200 or emailed HR@lsu.edu

title: Cm Analyst
description: POSITION PURPOSE Responsible for providing PdM services to Allied clients as directed by management. The Analyst assists in coordinating activities, scheduling work, and preparing the necessary technical reports. The Analyst will be accountable for ensuring compliance with all Allied, client, OSHA, and other applicable safety standards. The Analyst is also expected to be a technical resource to the client and employees in the troubleshooting of mechanical and electrical equipment. Analyst will be asked to perform specific projects and audits that will be assigned by supervision. Analysts are normally assigned an area of plant for collection, analysis and reporting of technical data. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES Performs program setup as required. Responsible for equipment walk down and information gathering. Responsible for assisting in the building and maintaining of technology databases. Assumes responsibility for communication and education between the company and clients. Responsible for communicating the Allied Reliability deliverables to the client. Ability to submit documented case studies for customer/employee newsletters. Assumes responsibility for necessary auditing, metrics and reporting, including but not limited to: Responsible that databases are in compliance with current standards. Responsible for assisting and reporting Nuisance Alarms. Responsible for assisting in the Management of Change Process. Responsible for the accuracy and the timeliness of all internal and external communications and reporting. Assumes responsibility for the overall safety of the work environment. Responsible for ensuring compliance with Allied Reliability, client, OSHA, and other applicable standards. Performs Behavioral Safety Observations as needed. Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned. Performs special projects as assigned. Ensures that work area is clean, secure, and well maintained. Training/Mentoring A few of the activities in the area of Training/Mentoring will include, but are not limited to: Assist in training/mentoring of new employees. Able to convey obtained knowledge from seminar/training sessions. Collects, Analyzes, and Reports on Technology Data Collects data in accordance with Allied Best Practices standards Maintains technology databases with current information Reports results in clear concise manner following all Allied procedures for content. Able and willing to work in an on-call situations and off shifts as required by customers or management. PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS Technical reports are accurate, neat, and promptly completed. Inquiries are courteously attended to. Good business relations exist with outside professionals and with customers. A professional image is projected and maintained. EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: High school graduate or equivalent. Technical Degree preferred. ASNT-TC1A or ASNT-CP189 Professional Certification or industry equivalent. Analysts must have ASNT-TC1A Level 2 Certification (or equivalent) in their core technology, Level 1 Certification (or equivalent) in secondary technology, and a minimum of 2 years direct PdM experience. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE: Knowledge of machinery fundamentals, including pumps, motors, gearboxes, blowers, compressors, switchgear etc. Detailed knowledge of general mechanical fundamentals, such as fits and tolerances. Working knowledge of routine and advanced data acquisition techniques. Working knowledge of other condition monitoring technologies. EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Two or more years of direct PdM experience SKILLS/ABILITIES: Good communication skills, both oral and written. Proficient computer skills, including but not limited to Windows, Word, and Excel. Solid analytical and problem-solving abilities. Able to work well independently. PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION REPETITIVE MOTIONS: Movements frequently and regularly required using the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. TALKING: Especially where one must frequently convey detailed or important instructions or ideas accurately, loudly, or quickly . GOOD VISUAL ABILITIES: Keen visual acuity necessary to prepare or inspect documents or products, or operate, inspect and adjust machinery. AVERAGE HEARING: Able to hear average or normal conversations and receive ordinary information. PHYSICAL STRENGTH: 50% Active work; often standing and/or lifting for long periods of time. Exerts up to 25 lbs. of force occasionally. 50% Sedentary computer work, often sitting for long periods of time. MENTAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION REASONING ABILITY: Ability to deal with a variety of variables under often hazardous work conditions. Able to interpret and communicate various instructions. MATHEMATICS ABILITY: Ability to perform basic math skills, use decimals to compute ratios and percents, and to draw and interpret graphs. LANGUAGE ABILITY: Ability to read a variety of books, magazines, instruction manuals, atlases, and encyclopedias. Ability to prepare memos, reports, and essays using proper punctuation, spelling, and grammar.

title: Scheduler
description: A Provisioning Analyst prepares, organizes, and produces specified provisioning, technical and logistics support documentation that includes compilation/analysis of source material in accordance with corporate, military, and commercial specifications and standards. The analyst must be able to support teams members, have intermediate skills utilizing computer software such as MS Office (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) in addition to continuously working with data in completing deliverables. The ideal candidate must have at least six (6) months of proven working experience in at least three (3) of the six (6) areas listed below: Provisioning Knowledge of parts and/or components of equipment Maintenance of equipment Maintenance of computer databases Interpret contract data Analyzing data Benefits 401k, Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Medical Insurance, Vision Powered by ExactHire:106423

title: Intelligence Analyst
description: Criminal Intelligence Analyst Prepares, analyzes, and disseminates information relevant to actual and anticipated criminal activity utilizing modern research methods including research design, statistical analysis, trends and patterns, victim and suspect profiling, and other quantitative research techniques. Applies knowledge of the criminal justice system and standard police procedures to determine the methodology of collecting and collating data from various software programs and databases. Prepares narrative statements summarizing retrieved information. “If you have currently passed a Civil Service test with a 75% or higher in this position, you must complete the and BRPD application. Links provided below:” EARNINGS As of Sept 10th, 2022 , new, Criminal Intelligence Analysts can earn up to $38,278 after one year. LISTED BELOW IS A BREAKDOWN OF ANNUAL EARNINGS Base starting salary $32,547 – annually After six months from the date of hire ( 3% merit increase) $33,522 – annually After one year from the date of hire ( 3% merit increase) $34,528 – after one year MERIT INCREASES FOR EACH YEAR OF SERVICE FOLLOWING (3%) See Benefits and Incentives Additional pay, annually with listed education: 80 + hours of college – $1,125 annually Bachelor’s degree – $3,000 annually Master’s degree – $3,750 annually Shift Hours Varies / Flexible Benefits Health, dental, and vision insurance Retirement plan 12 paid holidays per year Paid monthly vacation and sick leave accrual Military Leave

title: Data Scientist
description: All Job Postings will close at 12:01a.m. CST (1:01a.m. EST) on the specified Closing Date (if designated). If you close the browser or exit your application prior to submitting, the application progress will be saved as a draft. You will be able to access and complete the application through “My Draft Applications” located on your Candidate Home page. Job Posting Title: Research Data Scientist (IT Analyst 3) Position Type: Professional / Unclassified Department: LSUAM ORED - CCT - Materials - Computational (Daijiang Li (00065506)) Work Location: 1079 Digital Media Center Pay Grade: Professional Job Description: Applications are invited for a Data Scientist position funded by an NSF grant in the Li lab (https://www.dlilab.com) in the Department of Biological Sciences and the Center of Computation & Technology at LSU. This position involves computational work and no field work. This project is collaborative, and the Data Scientist will have opportunities to work with researchers and data scientists from other institutions such as the University of Florida, iNaturalist, Chicago Botanical Garden, and University of Arizona. Job Responsibilities: Major duties of this position include developing machine learning methods to extract phenological information (e.g., presence/absence of leaf, flower, fruit) from images such as photographs uploaded to iNaturalist and digitized specimens; building software to integrate existing phenological records from different networks as well as the extracted phenological data into a central phenology database (PhenoBase); disseminating and maintaining PhenoBase through online web portal and R/Python packages, and developing and organizing workshops and tutorials to train users to use PhenoBase and the developed machine learning methods. (85%) Help with organizing project meetings, mentoring undergraduate and graduate students working on similar projects. (10%) Other duties as assigned (5%) Minimum Qualifications: Ph.D. in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or other TEM field with strong data science and machine learning skills and interests in biology OR Ph.D. in Biology, Ecology, or other relevant discipline with strong data science skills. Strong software development skills (e.g., R, Python, C++), knowledge of databases, experience working with or developing OWL ontologies, and good oral and written communication skills. Physical Demands: Physical ability and eye-hand coordination necessary to use a computer terminal, copier, telephone and other standard office equipment; ability to sit in the same position for extended periods (5.5+ hours a day) at a time using continuous hand motions when entering data into the computer system. Additional Information: The preferred start date is January 2023 but can be slightly flexible. This position is fully funded for up to 30 months pending satisfactory performance with competitive salary (expectation $65,000/year). Our research group is committed to anti-racism and is diverse (https://www.dlilab.com/value/). Applicants from historically excluded groups are encouraged to apply. Additional Job Description: Special Instructions: Please attach ALL required documents under the "Resume/CV" section of your application. Please attach a cover letter, resume, and three professional references, including name, title, phone number, and e-mail address. A copy of your transcript(s) may be attached to your application (if available). However, original transcripts are required prior to hire. Posting Date: October 21, 2022 Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified): Additional Position Information: Background Check - An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. Benefits - LSU offers outstanding benefits to eligible employees and their dependents including health, life, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; retirement options; various leave options; paid holidays; wellness benefits; tuition exemption for qualified positions; training and development opportunities; employee discounts; and more! Essential Position (Y/N): LSU is an Equal Opportunity Employer: LSU believes diversity, equity, and inclusion enrich the educational experience of our students, faculty, and staff, and are necessary to prepare all people to thrive personally and professionally in a global society. We celebrate diversity and are committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion. We actively seek and encourage qualified applications from persons with diverse backgrounds, cultures and experiences. To learn more about how LSU is committed to diversity and inclusivity, please see LSU’s Diversity Statement and Roadmap . Persons needing accommodations or assistance with the accessibility of materials related to this search are encouraged to contact the Office of Human Resource Management ( hr@lsu.edu ). HCM Contact Information: Questions or concerns can be directed to the LSU Human Resources Management Office at 225-578-8200 or emailed HR@lsu.edu

title: Traffic Engineer
description: The Traffic Engineering Analyst performs professional engineering work by applying standard techniques, procedures, and criteria in carrying out routine engineering tasks under supervision. Responsibilities: The Traffic Engineering Analyst: Performs traffic and transportation systems analysis, traffic impact analysis, and corridor studies. Provides support to the professional engineering staff in the development of traffic and roadway plans and design. Applies prescribed methods to complete limited and specific portions of the broader assignment. Prepares preliminary analysis on a variety of technical tasks. Evaluates data to assist in creating solutions to transportation issues. Other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications: Degree in civil engineering, planning or related field. EIT certification or ability to acquire same within 3 months. 0-6 years of progressive experience performing engineering duties similar to those listed above. Particular consideration is given to experience with Traffic Impact Analysis, corridor mobility and long-term improvement analysis, and signal/electrical design. Knowledge of engineering software, programs, and methods used for duties described above. Desired Qualifications: Experience using SYNCHRO, CORSIM, VISSIM and similar modeling software. Experience with CADD software such as Microstation. Knowledge of and familiarity with transportation manuals and regulations. Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

title: Reporting Analyst
description: Interested in joining a fast-growing company with EVERY Friday off? As an Auditor on MRI’s Audit & Recovery team, you'll help build a growing organization, win over hospital, health system, and surgery center clients with superior customer service and service offerings. You’ll be a critical part of the growth of an emerging leader in hospital revenue cycle solutions. You will work alongside MRI team members to execute project plans which enhance the bottom-line profits for our clients. The Auditor will be responsible for activities focused on assessing/analyzing third party payments, including Managed Care, Medicare, and Medicaid, as it relates to hospital insurance reimbursement. This includes recording and analyzing data, filing appropriate appeals based on findings to ensure additional payment is received in a prompt manner. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Leverage data-mining and reimbursement modeling tools to review and identify underpayments/denials which are due for additional reimbursement from the payer Identify and document underpayment root causes by contacting payers via phone and through review of client systems and account documentation Submit written appeals detailing expected reimbursement and clearly outlining reasons for additional payment, including citation of contract language, policies, and industry standard in a persuasive manner Gain knowledge of general hospital policies and procedures, hospital underpayments, and revenue cycle maximization opportunities Ensures productivity and quality standards are met Participate in internal client meetings, contributing to a greater understanding of project and initiative progress Coaches/Partners with other team members Identify and research new placement concept opportunities Assist in client reporting Strict adherence to HIPAA privacy and security rules, including following MRI policy at all times All other duties as assigned Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Strong analytical, technical, and creative problem-solving skills Demonstrated ability to analyze, understand, and communicate complex issues and trends. Demonstrated interpersonal skills. Ability to clearly articulate goals and expectations to team members and communicate results to MRI Management. Customer-service orientation with ability to independently interact with a range of personalities and styles to establish effective relationships internally & externally. A positive and optimistic attitude that is maintained despite tight deadlines and competing priorities. Genuine enthusiasm for working for an evolving start-up with the ability to embrace new ideas. Ability to consistently demonstrate high personal ethics, integrity, prudence, energy, initiative, and self-confidence. Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree with Healthcare, Business, or relevant background preferred Relevant professional experience within Hospital/Insurance industry preferred Expertise within the MS Office Suite including Excel, Word, Outlook, and Access preferred Compensation and Benefits: Four (4) day work weeks Competitive salary commensurate on relevant experience Paid time off and holidays Health insurance package (partially paid by employer) 401(k) plan with employer match after one year of service Must work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Utilizes discretion and independent judgement to create reports utilizing Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services to meet business needs Proficient in Microsoft SQL Server as well as reading and writing complex SQL Create queries to validate and test reports. Assemble and analyze data for business reports, make sure data and calculations are accurate. Maintain, streamline, and automate monthly, quarterly, and annual compliance reporting. Create queries and reports for AdHoc requests from the Operations Management and Enterprise Services teams. Work within an Agile team and coordinate priorities with the Scrum Master and stake holders. Work with data and application development team to modify existing reports for any changes in internal system database schemas. Give guidance to the development teams on issues or data audit needs found during any data analysis. Examine reports to locate and resolve errors. Performs such other services as required. Learn data and business processes and utilize this knowledge to verify data, query and report output.

title: Technical Analyst
description: Position: Oracle Applications Functional Analysts Education: B.A. or B.S. degree. Basic Experience: Sr. Functional Analyst: At least 9 years ERP implementation experience; at least 2 full life-cycle implementations. Journeyman Functional Analyst: At least 4 years ERP implementation experience; at least 1 full life-cycle implementation. Jr. Functional Analyst: Up to 4 years ERP implementation experience; training or experience in Oracle modules and/or project implementation methodologies. Specialized Experience: Hands-on experience implementing Oracle Financials and related applications, preferably in a public sector environment. Knowledge of public sector accounting policies and system requirements, and experience with Oracle Budget, Procure-to-Pay, or Core Accounting. Able to define customer requirements, processes flows, and configure ERP system to meet customer requirements. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and/or Certified Government Financial Manager (CGFM) a big plus. Duties: Will serve as a member or team leader of a large public sector Oracle ERP implementation team. Will work with others team members to define requirements; interact with client team members; configure the applications; participate in unit, system, and integration testing; plan and execute cut-over; and provide post-implementation support. May be asked to provide preliminary configurations and lead client discussions in a Conference Room Pilot (CRP) mode. Must be able to grasp interrelationships between financial management requirements and automated solutions, considering the current system environment and the potential integration of other systems. Must be able to complete tasks in the timeframe specified by the client, and assist in the preparation of milestone status reports and presentations for team members and clients. Other Requirements: Must have strong writing skills (writing examples may be requested), as well as good oral communication skills. Contact: Send resumes or other information to: info@businessintelsolutions.com (reference Code OAFA-200903). No phone calls accepted.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
description: Job Summary The primary function of the Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) is to plan, develop, and monitor a variety of behavioral support service delivery options to meet the needs of clients diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) and/or other behavioral and social/communication challenges, and to supervise Line Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians. Qualifications Certification and Licensure: Required Registered Behavior Technician Certificate from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board. Licensed in the State of Louisiana Education and Experience: Required Bachelors Degree in Psychology, Education or Related Field of Study Required Master's degree in ABA, Psychology, Education, or Related Field of Study 1-3 years of experience preferred for entry-level positions Essential Functions, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Study patient behavior and apply ABA principles Respond appropriately to different situations common among Autism patients and others with behavioral and developmental challenges Utilize key communication skills to provide effective feedback to patients Effectively communicate positive feedback to patients Be able to recognize and respond to critical improvements in patient behaviors. Become familiar with and use behavioral redirection techniques Know how to respond to negative behaviors appropriately Provide written documentation on each patient Supervise and document supervision of Line Technicians and Registered Behavior Technicians Strong communication skills required Ability to work under high-stress situations Exhibits significant reliable habits, including timeliness and organizational skills Proven experience working with pre-school and elementary school-aged children Additional evidence of successful work with patients suffering from Autism and development issues Disclaimers Disclaimers: The above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions, subject to reasonable accommodations. All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or abilities deemed necessary to perform the job proficiently. This job description is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Employees may be required to perform any other job-related instructions, as requested by their supervisor/management.
